meanings.definition: A sweet, chewy candy made from the dried root of a European plant.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a piece of liquorice after dinner.
meanings.sent2: The children happily shared liquorice during the movie.
meanings.sent3: The liquorice was so sticky, it got stuck to my teeth!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as sweet as liquorice on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The smell of liquorice filled the room, tempting everyone to grab a piece.

meanings.definition: A plant of the pea family with spikes of blue flowers and flat pods, native to southern Europe and parts of Asia.
meanings.sent1: The liquorice plant in the garden attracted many bees.
meanings.sent2: Southern Europe is known for its beautiful liquorice plants.
meanings.sent3: The liquorice plant waved in the breeze, showing off its blue flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her garden was a sea of liquorice plants, a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The liquorice plant's pods were like hidden treasures waiting to be discovered.
